body: Fixed in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/7000.
Hi, I'm having the same issue. I recently migrated yml to toml config file with `alacritty migrate` and I get **[WARN] Unused config key: schemes** when I open a new terminal.
unused key: footer_bar, should I define it? why doesn't it using default value?

>unused key: footer_bar, should I define it? why doesn't it using default value?

it means that you should remove it because it's not used.

>[WARN] Unused config key: schemes

you should also remove it or comment out.

> > [WARN] Unused config key: schemes
> 
> you should also remove it or comment out.

It was defined in the theme, thank you.

> Hi, I'm having the same issue. I recently migrated yml to toml config file with `alacritty migrate` and I get **[WARN] Unused config key: schemes** when I open a new terminal.

did you solve this? having the same issue of "unused config key:schemes"

> > Hi, I'm having the same issue. I recently migrated yml to toml config file with `alacritty migrate` and I get **[WARN] Unused config key: schemes** when I open a new terminal.
> 
> did you solve this? having the same issue of "unused config key:schemes"

Hi, yes. Just delete or comment the lines starting with [schemes]. I think they are no longer used in the new toml config files. 
Happy new year! :)

Happy New Year ! :)

in my case had to comment this
```
# [colors.cursor]
# cursor = "CellForeground"
# style = "Block"
# text = "CellBackground"


```

> > unused key: footer_bar, should I define it? why doesn't it using default value?
> 
> it means that you should remove it because it's not used.

I also had a warning about `footer_bar`, I also removed it and it did fix the warning that was being displayed. But I find this strange, because
 * It is defined in the [official doc](https://alacritty.org/config-alacritty.html)
 * It does have an effect on the theme when I set it to different colors:
 
![image](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/1062625/4e780813-0721-4a11-8466-ac74a9f0b9eb)
![image](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/assets/1062625/ff09d10e-b61a-4fe3-b29b-86650c96c2fe)
It could be defined in a theme you export.
Yes, it is defined in my theme, what I don’t get is why there is a warning saying it’s not used whereas it clearly _is_ used.
You likely have keys duplicated? Like you have one working and other not...

Ok I got it, in fact I had a `colors.search.footer_bar` property that is actually unused, but the `colors.footer_bar` one is used. You helped me by talking about duplicates though, thanks ! TBH it would be easier if the warning message mentioned the whole path of the culprit.
I get Unused config key: schemes, but i don't have schemes mentioned in the alacritty.toml file
If something isn't used it should be removed or commented out.
your config is fine, ensure that it's the one that is loaded with `alacritty -vv`, If I run alacritty on your config with `alacritty --config-file` I don't have warnings.

The `-vv` should log you what config it's reading.

e.g.
```
[0.000387051s] [INFO ] [alacritty] Configuration files loaded from:
                                     "/home/kchibisov/.config/alacritty/alacritty.toml"
```

So ensure that it's actually loading the file you use and not file from other location because it's _earlier_ on the list.
> /home/peep/.config/alacritty/color.toml
And the only way it can read it if you have `import` in `/home/peep/.config/alacritty/alacritty.toml` pointing to `color`.

Shouldn't the error message be "The property [x] does not exist" or "is unknown".  
What does `Unused config key: copy_on_select` even mean? "Not used" where?
Why is this closed? The issue is so not fixed
But I still encountered this problem when I used import.
